summary: This document is an email chain from July 2021 between an Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York and American Express Global Security/Financial Intelligence Unit personnel. The AUSA is following up on a prior document production related to Jeffrey Epstein, specifically regarding subpoenaed records and certified financial documentation.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The email sender from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York who is requesting a follow-up call to ask questions about an earlier document production related to Epstein.

persons.name: Yui Cheung Chow
persons.role: Manager - Special Investigations, Financial Intelligence Unit
persons.context: An American Express employee in the Financial Intelligence Unit who was copied on an email regarding a subpoena link for Epstein-related records.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The prosecutor is contacting American Express personnel, including Yui Cheung Chow, as part of a financial investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, seeking information and certified records.

events.title: Follow-up on Epstein Document Production
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney requests a call with American Express personnel to ask follow-up questions regarding an earlier document production related to Jeffrey Epstein.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Subpoena Access Issue
events.description: An American Express manager reports that a link for a subpoena related to Epstein is not accessible, indicating ongoing legal requests for financial records.

locations: 200 Vesey St, New York, NY 10285-0102 (American Express Global Security New York Office)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York)
18850 N. 56th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85058 (American Express Financial Intelligence Unit)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's financial records through American Express as of July 2021.
American Express Global Security and its Financial Intelligence Unit were involved in producing documents, including certified records, in response to legal requests.
There was a prior document production related to Epstein that prompted follow-up questions from federal prosecutors.
The correspondence highlights the use of subpoenas to obtain financial records from American Express in the Epstein investigation.
